title: Amazon KDP Tutorial for Beginners – Keyword Research That Works (2026)

tactics.name: buyer_intent_filtering
tactics.description: Shift from keyword-focused to audience-specific targeting by identifying problem-aware searches and emotional intent.
steps: Think about the target audience (age, problem, emotion, situation) instead of keywords
Use specific emotional intent keywords like 'anxiety journal for overthinkers at night'
caveats: Fails when keywords are duplicated in backend without new intent
source_quotes: Keywords are no longer traffic tools. They are audience filters.

tactics.name: keyword_clustering
tactics.description: Group related buyer intent phrases to rank for multiple searches without keyword stuffing.
steps: Add 3-6 supporting phrases describing the same problem differently
caveats: Requires listing alignment across all cluster phrases
source_quotes: Amazon connects these automatically if your listing is aligned.

tactics.name: Keyword Relevance Matching
tactics.description: Focus on keywords that align with buyer intent, emotional triggers, and clear outcomes to avoid ranking drops.
steps: Validate keyword relevance with real-time BSR data
Use tools to identify low-competition, high-intent keywords

tactics.name: Tool Integration Strategy
tactics.description: Combine paid and free tools to optimize keyword research and ranking efficiency.
steps: Use Publisher Rocket for niche analysis
Leverage Kipcout for real-time BSR data
caveats: Free tools may lack advanced analytics
source_quotes: 'Use one paid tool if you can. Combine it with one free tool.'

heuristics.name: low_review_launch_boost
source_quotes: Most people fail. They launch straight into competitive keywords.

heuristics.name: Review Count Threshold
heuristics.condition: If a book has fewer than 200 reviews, prioritize boosting its visibility
source_quotes: 'A book with five reviews outranks a book with 200.'

claims.statement: Amazon ranks books based on buyer behavior, not keywords alone.
source_quotes: Amazon ranks books based on signis. Your keyword is just the door.

claims.statement: Amazon prioritizes relevance over reputation in rankings

niche_patterns.description: Target specific audience segments with clear constraints for low-competition niches.
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Combines identity (teen boys), problem (ADHD), and constraint (Christian) for precise filtering.
source_quotes: Would you rather 1,000 people click and not buy or 50 people click and buy immediately?
